response: "Why can't I just be myself without feeling judged by everyone around me?"
"I feel like I'm constantly chasing this ideal of perfection that doesn't even exist."
"I don't understand why society puts so much pressure on women to look a certain way. It's driving me crazy."
"I'm starting to lose touch with reality, constantly questioning if I'm good enough."
"Every time I try to meet society's standards, it feels like the goalpost keeps moving further away."
"I'm exhausted from trying to please everyone else. When will I be able to prioritize my own happiness?"
"It's like I'm trapped in this never-ending cycle of trying to be perfect, but it's impossible."
"I can't help but feel like I'm losing myself in this constant pursuit of perfection."
"The pressure to be flawless is suffocating. I wish I could just break free from it all."
"Sometimes I wonder if I'm the only one feeling this way, or if everyone else is just better at pretending."
